Legal_Issue: Was the immigration officer's decision to dismiss Perez Enriquez's application reasonable and did it violate the duty of fairness?
Evidence_Assessment: Perez Enriquez failed to provide conclusive evidence of full-time employment for one year; officer questioned evidence during interview
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant must prove they meet residency requirements
Credibility_Factor: Discrepancies in employment history, failure to clarify doubts
Legal_Rule: The officer's decision must be reasonable, considering evidence provided and meeting procedural fairness standards
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of procedural fairness and unreasonableness in dismissal of application
Outcome_on_Merits: No breach of fairness or unreasonableness found
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer allowed applicant to respond during interview; procedural fairness duties fulfilled
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged reasonableness and fairness of application dismissal
Defendant_Response: Officer acted within reason and provided opportunity to respond
Remedy_Requested: Certification of questions, successful judicial review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to meet residency requirement due to insufficient employment evidence
Outcome_of_Review: No certification of questions, application dismissed
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Judicial review of immigration application dismissal
Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness and reasonableness in administrative decision-making
